comments.body: the ``vs`` here is not necessary, as you are already skipping ``vc<14`` just the ``vs2017`` will be used

If I just keep `vc<14`, it will be using `vs2015` but in this case, I am intended to use `vs2017` for better modern `C++` support. Anyway, I am trying to remove `vc<14`, and see if I can just keep one kind of specification here to reduce confusion.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +24,28 @@    - {{ compiler('c') }}                # [not win]
    - vs2017_win-64                      # [win64]
    - vs2017_win-32                      # [win32]
    - ninja
    - cmake
